intro: Myrsine andina, commonly known as Andean myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy, dark green surface. The flowers are small, white or pink, and clustered in umbels, often blooming in spring.
